metaData.descriptionCS: On Expressive Vocabulary, the examinee says the word that best corresponds to a given picture and definition. On Oral Word Fluency, the examinee names as many things as possible belonging to a given category (i.e., animals, colors) within 60 seconds. On Sentence Repetition the examinee listens to sentences that increase in length and complexity and repeats each sentence verbatim.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 1. Toothbrush
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect response:

Score 0. Point to the toothbrush and say, What is this?

If the examinee does not answer correctly, say, This is a toothbrush. Let's try again. Tell me the word that means a brush for cleaning teeth.

Encourage the examinee to provide the correct response, and then proceed to Item 2 by saying, Let's try some more.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Look at this picture. Tell me the word that means a brush for cleaning teeth.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 2. Butterfly
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a flying insect with large, brightly colored wings.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 3. Closet
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a small place where clothes are stored.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 4. Crawl
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means to move on hands and knees.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 5. Calculator
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a small electronic device used to do math problems.

answers.popoverText: Say, Tell me another word that means a small electronic device used to do math problems.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 6. Straight
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means not crooked.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 7. Measure
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me that word that means to find how long something is.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 8. Keys
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means the part of the piano played with the fingers.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 9. Intersection
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means the place where two roads cross.

answers.popoverText: Say, Tell me another word that means the place where two roads cross.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 10. Vote
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means to make your choice known in an election.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 11. Disguise
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means to change the way you look, so others won't recognize you.

answers.popoverText: Say, Tell me another word that means to change the way you look, so others won't recognize you.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 12. Escape
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means to break loose or get free.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 13. Pedestrian
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a person who is walking.

answers.popoverText: Say, Tell me another word that means a person who is walking.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 14. Peninsula
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a long piece of land that juts out into a sea or lake.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 15. Ambidextrous
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means able to use both hands equally well.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 16. Oasis
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a fertile, green area where water can be found in a desert.

questions.title: Expressive Vocabulary Item 17. Centenarian
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Tell me the word that means a person who is at least 100 years old.

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest  discontinues after 4 consecutive scores of 0 points
Subtest requires 4 consecutive scores of 0 points

choiceList.question:
Say, I am going to say some sentences. I want you to repeat exactly what I say. Just say what I say. Let's try.

Say, The boy smiled.
choiceList.correct:
Correct response:

Say, Let's try some more. Remember to say exactly what I say.

choiceList.question:
Say, Say exactly what I say.

Say, The boy smiled.
choiceList.correct:
Correct response:

Say, Let's try some more. Remember to say exactly what I say.
choiceList.wrong:
Incorrect response:

Say, You need to say, The boy smiled.

Say, Let's try some more. Remember to say exactly what I say.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 1
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Games are fun.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 2
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Cats don't like to swim.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 3
questions.topInstructionsHTML: That is mine, but this one is yours.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 4
questions.topInstructionsHTML: It is cold outside and many of the roads are icy.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 5
questions.topInstructionsHTML: When you go climbing, watch for falling rocks.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 6
questions.topInstructionsHTML: The bird escaped from the cage and flew out the window.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 7
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Unless you have permission, you are not allowed to go swimming.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 8
questions.topInstructionsHTML: I walked to the store and bought a sandwich, an apple, and a drink.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 9
questions.topInstructionsHTML: The cat was asleep by the window while the dog chased butterflies in the grass.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 10
questions.topInstructionsHTML: I studied every day this week for the exam, so I think I will get a good grade.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 11
questions.topInstructionsHTML: That restaurant has become popular since it moved to a new location last summer.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 12
questions.topInstructionsHTML: The man wanted to keep the wallet he found on the ground, yet he knew it was not the right thing to do.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 13
questions.topInstructionsHTML: The animals at the zoo had gone inside because of the heat, so we did not see a single one.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 14
questions.topInstructionsHTML: The baby always used to cry when her mother left the room, and nothing but her mother's return would stop her crying.

questions.title: Sentence Repetition Item 15
questions.topInstructionsHTML: The driver charged everyone the same fee for the trip, but when the bus got stuck in the mud all the money had to be refunded.

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest discontinues after 4 consecutive scores of 0 points
